sentences.english: But Wang's peers didn't think he deserved a strong punishment.
sentences.chinese: 但王林的同龄人却不认为他应受重罚。

sentences.english: President Medvedev also called for tough punishment against officers who will abuse their position.
sentences.chinese: 梅德奥杰夫亦对滥用职权的官员予以重罚。

sentences.english: He who beholds the gods against their will, shall atone for it by a heavy penalty.
sentences.chinese: 谁违背神的意志看见了神，就要受到重罚以赎罪。

sentences.english: Any men caught impersonating women will be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人化装成女士，一经发现便将受到重罚。

sentences.english: When you are cheating because you want money you will have lots of lots of heavy punishments. First they will quit you from job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你为了钱去作弊，那你将遭到重罚。

sentences.english: And a court slapped a big fine on an opposition newspaper for slandering a parliamentarian.
sentences.chinese: 法院对一家异议报纸因为抨击国会苛以重罚。

definition: in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
lit. not to change, despite repeated admonition/incorrigible/unrepentant
lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
